archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Herb-Roasted Chicken Thighs with Lemon Potatoes, Carrots, and Pan Sauce
description: Roasted chicken thighs with thyme and rosemary, paired with lemony potatoes, sweet carrots, and a quick white wine–herb pan sauce. Built for low-sodium cooking with bright citrus and fresh herbs instead of added salt.
prep_steps: Line a large sheet pan with parchment (optional for easy cleanup).
Trim excess fat from 8 chicken thighs and pat dry.
Scrub 2 lb potatoes; cut into 1-inch chunks.
Peel 4 carrots; cut into 1/2-inch thick sticks or coins.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Zest 1 lemon, then cut it in half (reserve zest and juice separately).
Strip leaves from several sprigs of thyme and rosemary; roughly chop 2 Tbsp mixed herbs.
Measure 1/2 cup white wine and 1/2 cup vegetable stock.
cook_steps: In a large bowl, toss potatoes and carrots with 1.5 Tbsp olive oil, half the minced garlic, half the chopped herbs, black pepper, and half the lemon zest.

On the sheet pan, spread the potatoes and carrots in a single layer. Nestle chicken thighs on top. Brush chicken with 1 Tbsp olive oil and sprinkle with remaining chopped herbs, black pepper, and remaining lemon zest. Squeeze half the lemon over everything.

Toss green beans with 1 tsp olive oil and black pepper. After the first 25 minutes, add green beans to the pan around the chicken. Roast 10–15 minutes more, until chicken is cooked through (165°F/74°C) and vegetables are tender with browned edges.
Transfer chicken and vegetables to a platter, tent loosely with foil. Pour any pan juices into a small skillet.

Place skillet over medium heat. Add remaining minced garlic; cook 30 seconds. Add white wine; simmer 2–3 minutes, scraping brown bits. Add vegetable stock and a squeeze of lemon juice; simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly syrupy. Whisk in 1 tsp olive oil for sheen. Season with black pepper and extra lemon to taste.
Spoon pan sauce over chicken. Serve with roasted potatoes, carrots, and green beans.
